title: Print, "The Curiosity of the Chinese", 1750–75
medium: Hand colored etching with watercolor and gold on paper
inscribed: Between the representation adn the border: "LA CURIOSIDAD DE LOC CHINOS CURIOSITAS SINENSIS LA CURIOSITE CHINOISE."
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: A woman holds a small child up to look into a peepshow operated by a man in plumed hat. A seated woman plays a lute, at right. Two other children at left, before a trellis arcade. Wide ornamental border composed of scroll motifs, flowers and a canopy at top.

tombstone.epitaph: Print, "The Curiosity of the Chinese", 1750–75. Hand colored etching with watercolor and gold on paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1921-22-256.
